intro: Duretia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy duretia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Duretia hirtella is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories.
